intro: Boecherarctica narthorstii, commonly known as the Arctic bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the Arctic and subarctic regions. It is characterized by its low-growing habit and small, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant thrives in cold, nutrient-poor environments, often found in tundra and alpine habitats. Its leaves are typically narrow and covered in a dense layer of fine hairs to protect against harsh weather. Boecherarctica narthorstii plays an important role in the ecological balance of its native ecosystems.
